Posts.Content: Hey Victoria I'm new too :o) and am at exactly the same stage as you. Had the lumpectomy and lymph gland also removed. Waiting to start FEC, should be in about 2 weeks. I totally know what you mean about the waiting, a real pain!!! Still not sure about the cold cap, but can honestly say losing me hair on me head isn't a worry its me eye brows. Silly really as my partner says you can't really see them anyway!  Hope you hear from the hospial soon and good luck with the cold cap  xx
Posts.Title: Cold Cap & Exercise

Posts.Content: Hi all I'm 33 and was dianosed with breast cancer early April of this year. People keep saying i'm very young to have it!! As flattering as the young bit is, is this true??? I would like to know if there is anyone else of my age or younger going through this. Any one???? :0)
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????

Posts.Content: Hello Tamli  I start chemo on the 24th of this month, followed by radio therapy. How did you get on with the chemo? Lorna x :0)
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????

Posts.Content: Laughter Yoga, Sarah that sounds brilliant :0) think i'll have to look into that x
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????

Posts.Content: Hey Alison Worst birthday present ever!!!! Glad to hear the lymph node was clear though, that was my biggest worry. And i have a good friend at work who had breast cancer about 18 months ago, she's middle 40's. Seeing her go through it has made it a lot easier for me, really nice to speak with someone who gets all my moans and groans :0). She didn't have chemo though just radio and tomixifen. So we'll be sharing hot flushes at least!! I wasn't to worried about the chemo untill last week, when i got my date to start (24th,next week!!) I think the reality of it all is really starting to sink in!! I've already had my hair cut short in preperation.  I'm in Northolt Middx, so if your inside the M25 you can't be that far from me. I've just signed up for a breast cancer forum in London on the 1st and 2nd of july. Its for young women. You might want to take a look, it looks really great and they put you up in a hotel for the night and it's all free :0). I came across it on the breast cancer care web site. Hope you get good results Friday, let me know how it goes. Lorna x
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????

Posts.Content: Thanks Vicky, i didn't think it could of been that rare!! And unfortunatly i'm no where near Birmingham way, i'm more London, it would be quite a trek!!! :0) Shame as i've tried looking and there are support groups local but none for younger women. I don't mind to much about meeting people of similar age as this site already has been of great support for me. But nice to know there are more of you like me on here to share some of the issues i might face. (i think i may of worded that all wrong, i made it sound like i'm some sort of different spieces from another planet!!! lol.) xx
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????

Posts.Content: I was going to say it's nice to hear from so many young people with breast cancer. But then thought someone might post that on the dumb things people say, lol. But i guess what i should be saying is it's nice not feel alone. Bexjai where are you at with your treatment? Lorna ;0)
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????

Posts.Content: Hi Blue70 I'm sure once this is all over we'll be asking our selfs, what the hell was that all about!!! I'm just looking at this as a blip. Not a nice one admitedly but something i can beat. Where abouts in london are you? Lorna :0)
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????

Posts.Content: Bexjai i hope you get the results we all want to hear.  And i know what you mean about people expecting us to crack up. I even said to my breast care nurse the other day is it normal that i haven't fallen to pieces yet!!! Bless her, her responce to me was i think your amazing, I'll take that as not normal!! If i'm honest i have had a few moments but only because i worry about the affect it has on my family.  Staying positive and humour is most definatly the way forward with cancer and life in general. Lorna :0) x
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????
